text: [Music]
we're here in the Memorial neighbourhood
of Houston about 15 miles west of
downtown I've been in Texas for about a
week covering the aftermath of Harvey
and memorial on Saturday was unlike
anything I've ever seen most of the
neighborhood was waist-deep in water but
we saw some cars that were nearly
submerged in some front steps that were
just above the waterline a boy pushing a
raft into an apartment complex people
salvaging what they can by hauling
waterproof boxes through the murky
waters it felt like all possible modes
of transportation were being used some
people were waiting through there were
boats and trucks of all sizes rafts
canoes kayaks volunteers from Houston
and all around the region were rescuing
pets salvaging whatever they could and
in some cases trying to convince
residents who were still in their homes
to evacuate the area's flat but the
current was surprisingly strong in some
spots at one point the surprise current
pushed us directly into the hood of an
abandoned car many of the voters weren't
experienced a few hours after we left
Memorial Houston mayor Sylvester Turner
ordered a mandatory evacuation of the
area it's unclear what happens next for
this neighborhood and its residents
while other neighborhoods in the city
are already being rebuilt memorial may
be in water for weeks
[Music]
